intro: Brachiolobos hispidus, commonly known as the hairy brachiolobos, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves that give it its scientific name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Brachiolobos hispidus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
